title: compressed sans
content:
Hi everyone,

I thought this would be easy but... Any idea about this nice compressed font?  
Thanks! and sorry for the blurry youtube image

Font: 

 Helvetica Inserat 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104624/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")

author: Fruitor

comments.content:
As you note the image is blurry, so I can't say 100% Might be Helvetica Inserat [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104624/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica-inserat/") designed in 1966.  
Don

Concur with Don on Helvetica Inserat to be closest one for this time period and even if it looks a bit different to me and I'm not talking about the collateral damage of the all-around blur.  
Depending on what you need, I'd probably suggest to switch for [Chalet Comprimé](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317104624/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/chaletcomprime).

Thank you Don and Ryuk,  
I agree with you both that is doesnt look exactly like Helvetica Inserat, so the case is still mysterious, but thanks a lot Ryuk for suggesting Chalet Comprimé. "Hong Kong 1960" works absolutely right for me.
